channel.title: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *
channel.description:
How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen because when it is viewed, it only goes in the game view screen.
Exmaple: [img]http://i792.photobucket.com/albums/yy205/Have_A_Wii/test.jpg[/img]

item.title: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *
item.dc:creator: @burizo burizo
item.description:
@burizo wrote:

You need to change in login.java where it sets the mainframe interface, and add the welcome screen before it sets the mainframe.[

thank you very very much i will try

Read full topic
item.source: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *

item.title: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:3, topic:316773”]You need to change in login.java where it sets the mainframe interface, and add the welcome screen before it sets the mainframe.[/quote]Thanks, any idea on how to do this for 525? Since are classes are a little different than the 508’s.

item.title: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You need to change in login.java where it sets the mainframe interface, and add the welcome screen before it sets the mainframe.

item.title: * How do I make a 508 interface fill the game screen? *
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

I have the same problem with my 525: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,412936.0.html

You need to remove the window pane, but if you do it stuffs up the client. So you will need to change it to something that works, or find another way around it.

Read full topic
